answers.answer: Hello,Your doctor should be keeing a close eye on your blood sugars before, during and after the surgery.  The stress of surgery, change in diet habits and side effects of medications can have many different effects on your glucose metabolism. The main things to ask your doctor are in regard to how your blood sugars will be monitored during the surgery and afterwards, and how they will be treated(usually with insulin in the short term).Take care.

question: This is my first surgery since being diagnosed with Type 2 Diabetes II.  My diabetes is under control with diet, weight loss and exercise.  My question is what type of questions should I be asking my Dr.  The type of surgery is Pelvic Organ Prolapse.  Thank You.
title: Surgery with Diabetes II
